subject: Re: Interesting article
msgSnippet: Benct: Thanks for the interesting article.  I haven t had time to get through it all, but I will.  I ve saved a copy on my computer. Also:  forgive my
messageBody:
Benct:

Thanks for the interesting article. I haven't had time to get through
it all, but I will. I've saved a copy on my computer.

Also: forgive my ignorance of Swedish, but are the problems with its
phoneme to grapheme correspondence sufficiently severe to justify
revising its alphabet?

Paige


--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, Benct Philip Jonsson <bpj@...>
wrote:
>
> Dear friends,
>
> I just wanted to call your attention to an article
> that ought to be of interest to anyone engaged in
> spelling reform:
>
> <http://www.phon.ucl.ac.uk/home/wells/accents_spellingreform.htm>
>
>
> /BP 8^)>
>
> Still mulling on how to adapt Quikscript to Swedish...
>
> --
> Benct Philip Jonsson -- melroch at melroch dot se
>
> "Maybe" is a strange word. When mum or dad says it
> it means "yes", but when my big brothers say it it
> means "no"!
>
> (Philip Jonsson jr, age 7)
>
